title: Citing Omicron, South Korea Tells Unvaccinated Teens to Get Covid-19 Shots or Face Restrictions
sub_head: Individuals age 12 to 17 will be barred from restaurants and libraries if they don’t get vaccinated by February
body:
SEOUL—The Omicron variant has prompted South Korea to accelerate efforts to vaccinate school children, and penalize those who don’t comply, sparking debates over the safety of Covid-19 shots and education access.
In recent days, South Korean officials have given a February deadline for individuals between the ages of 12 and 17 to get vaccinated. If they don’t, the students risk being denied entry to restaurants, libraries and after-school academies that are central to many students’ education.
